title: Unnecessary DNS Lookups to raw.githubusercontent.com
body:
**Description:**

We are running a private blockchain using the Besu client on a VM with an internal network setup. We have observed continuous DNS lookups to **raw.githubusercontent.com**, which I believe are unnecessary for this setup.

**Setup Details:**

Besu Version: 23.4.0

OS: Linux RHEL 8

Number of Nodes: 4
All nodes are running on the same VM, as part of different **docker containers using besu docker image** and are part of the same internal docker network.

**IBFT** algorithm is used for blockchain consensus protocol as part of this network.


**Expected Behavior:**

Given that my nodes are all on an internal network and  not relying on external configurations/scripts, I would expect no external DNS lookups, especially continuous ones.

**Actual Behavior:**
Continuous DNS lookups to raw.githubusercontent.com.

What could be the expected resolution for this.

Here is the reference in the [code](https://github.com/search?q=repo%3Ahyperledger%2Fbesu%20raw.githubusercontent.com&type=code).
